sentence.text: The gonadoblastoma gene, testis-specific protein Y-encoded (sex differentiation), on the Y chromosome and its X-homologue, negative regulation of DNA replication, are cell cycle regulators and function as a proto-oncogene and a tumor suppressor respectively in human oncogenesis.

sex differentiation and negative regulation of DNA replication co-localize with the endogenous oxidation-reduction process, in the presence of ligand, on the promoters and differentially regulate the expression of the endogenous AR target genes in the androgen-responsive LNCaP prostate cancer cells.

Hence, negative regulation of cell adhesion differentiation and negative regulation of DNA replication exert opposing effects on the transactivation functions of oxidation-reduction process and AR-Vs important for various physiological and disease processes sensitive to male sex hormone actions, thereby not only affecting the pathogenesis of male-specific prostate cancer but also likely contributing to sex differences in the health and diseases of man
